title: Drawing, "Design for Painted Decoration of a Wall", 1840–60
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper
markings: Verso, in graphite: Dieses Muster mit Fr. [...] blau licht / Rasen Bordure.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims
description: A dado is shown at the bottom, an entablature and two stripes on top. The panel shows rising, waved, intertwined garlands, with a central motif in the ovoidal forms. Rows of lozenge rosettes are disposed so that their greatest widths are beside the crossing points of the garlands. A frieze consisting of halves of palmettes and three stripes, both motifs in purple, are on top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Painted Decoration of a Wall", 1840–60.
1840–60. Brush and gouache, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims. 1940-120-13.
